articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Crispian Balmer, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Royalty, presidents, prime ministers and a legion of faithful will pay their last respects to Pope Francis on Saturday at a funeral Mass in St. Peter's Square to honour his sometimes turbulent papacy.
articles.title: Royalty and presidents to join multitude of mourners at Pope Francis' funeral

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Syria has responded in writing to a list of U.S. conditions for possible partial sanctions relief, saying it had acted on most of them but others required "mutual understandings" with Washington, according to a copy of the letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syrian letter delivers response to US conditions for sanctions relief

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Top Iranian and U.S. negotiators will meet again on Saturday to hammer out a new deal curbing Tehran's advancing nuclear programme, while U.S. President Donald Trump signalled confidence in clinching a new pact that would block Iran's path to a nuclear bomb.
articles.title: Iran, US to resume talks in Oman to narrow gaps over new nuclear deal

articles.author: Christian Lowe, Andrii Pryimachenko
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has met U.S. President Donald Trump in the Italian capital, where both leaders were attending the funeral of Pope Francis, a spokesman for Zelenskiy said.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy met Trump in Rome, Zelenskiy's office says

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: Indian and Pakistani troops exchanged gunfire for a second straight day on Saturday as ties plummeted between the two nuclear-armed neighbours after an attack on tourists blamed on Pakistani militants killed 26 in India's Kashmir region.
articles.title: India, Pakistan exchange gunfire for 2nd day as ties plummet after attack

articles.author: Wa Lone, Kyawsoe Oo
articles.description: Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre strode on stage for a rally at a union headquarters north of Toronto, as Canadian country music blared.
articles.title: Young Canadians favor Conservatives in election despite Trump threat

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Samuel Mckeith
articles.description: Giuffre was one of the first people to call for criminal prosecution against Epstein, which he eventually faced.
articles.title: Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre dies by suicide, her family says

articles.author: Elias Biryabarema
articles.description: Uganda on Saturday declared an end to the country's latest outbreak of ebola, three months after authorities confirmed cases of the highly infectious and often fatal viral hemorrhagic infection in the capital Kampala.
articles.title: Uganda declares end to latest ebola outbreak

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A large explosion rocked Shahid Rajaee port in the southern Iranian city of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, with at least 47 people injured after the blast, state media reported.
articles.title: At least 47 injured after explosion at port in Iran's Bandar Abbas

articles.author: Francesco Canepa, Jan Strupczewski, Leika Kihara
articles.description: Global policymakers gathering in Washington this week breathed a collective sigh of relief that the U.S.-centric economic order that prevailed for the past 80 years was not collapsing just yet despite Donald Trump's inward-looking approach.
articles.title: World breathes sigh of relief as Trump spares Fed, IMF
